description: Uploaded by https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/runbooks/-/jobs/2222920320 at Fri Mar 18 18:32:27 UTC 2022

panels.description: Error rates are a measure of unhandled service exceptions per second. Client errors are excluded when possible. Lower is better

seriesOverrides.alias: 6h Degradation SLO (5% of monthly error budget)
1h Outage SLO (2% of monthly error budget)

targets.legendFormat: 6h Degradation SLO (5% of monthly error budget)
1h Outage SLO (2% of monthly error budget)

panels.title: logging Service Error Ratio

targets.expr:
sum (
  label_replace(
    vector(0) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_1h{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",type="logging"}),
    "period", "na", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(1) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_5m{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",type="logging"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (14.4 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{component="",monitor="global",type="logging"})),
    "period", "5m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(2) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_1h{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",type="logging"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (14.4 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{component="",monitor="global",type="logging"})),
    "period", "1h", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(4) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_30m{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",type="logging"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (6 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{component="",monitor="global",type="logging"})),
    "period", "30m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(8) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_6h{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",type="logging"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (6 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{component="",monitor="global",type="logging"})),
    "period", "6h", "", ""
  )
)

panels.description: The operation rate is the sum total of all requests being handle for all components within this service. Note that a single user request can lead to requests to multiple components. Higher is busier.
panels.title: logging Service RPS - Requests per Second

panels.description: Saturation is a measure of what ratio of a finite resource is currently being utilized. Lower is better.
panels.title: Saturation

panels.content:

panels.description: Error rates are a measure of unhandled service exceptions per second. Client errors are excluded when possible. Lower is better

1h Outage SLO (2% of monthly error budget)

1h Outage SLO (2% of monthly error budget)

panels.title: fluentd_log_output SLI Error Ratio

targets.expr:
sum (
  label_replace(
    vector(0) and on() (gitlab_component_errors:ratio_1h{component="fluentd_log_output",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",type="logging"}),
    "period", "na", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(1) and on() (gitlab_component_errors:ratio_5m{component="fluentd_log_output",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",type="logging"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (14.4 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{component="fluentd_log_output",monitor="global",type="logging"})),
    "period", "5m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(2) and on() (gitlab_component_errors:ratio_1h{component="fluentd_log_output",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",type="logging"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (14.4 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{component="fluentd_log_output",monitor="global",type="logging"})),
    "period", "1h", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(4) and on() (gitlab_component_errors:ratio_30m{component="fluentd_log_output",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",type="logging"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (6 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{component="fluentd_log_output",monitor="global",type="logging"})),
    "period", "30m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(8) and on() (gitlab_component_errors:ratio_6h{component="fluentd_log_output",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",type="logging"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (6 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{component="fluentd_log_output",monitor="global",type="logging"})),
    "period", "6h", "", ""
  )
)

* [Google Load Balancer](https://console.cloud.google.com/net-services/loadbalancing/details/http/ops-prod-proxy?project=gitlab-ops)
* [Stackdriver Logs: Loadbalancer Access Logs](https://console.cloud.google.com/logs/query;query=resource%2Elabels%2Etarget%5Fproxy%5Fname%3D%22ops%2Dprod%2Dproxy%22%0Aresource%2Etype%3D%22http%5Fload%5Fbalancer%22;timeRange=PT30M?project=gitlab-ops)
* [Stackdriver Logs: Loadbalancer Access 5xx Logs](https://console.cloud.google.com/logs/query;query=httpRequest%2Estatus%3E%3D500%0Aresource%2Elabels%2Etarget%5Fproxy%5Fname%3D%22ops%2Dprod%2Dproxy%22%0Aresource%2Etype%3D%22http%5Fload%5Fbalancer%22;timeRange=PT30M?project=gitlab-ops)

### Description

This SLI monitors pubsub topics.



### Observability Tools

* [ðŸ“– Kibana: Pubsubbeat logs](https://log.gprd.gitlab.net/app/kibana#/discover?_a=(columns:!(kubernetes.host,json.message),filters:!((meta:(key:json.type,params:pubsubbeat,type:phrase),query:(match:(json.type:(query:pubsubbeat,type:phrase))))),index:'c1ee6e20-fbf1-11ea-af41-ad80f197fa45')&_g=(time:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}')))
* [ðŸ“ˆ Kibana: Pubsubbeat requests](https://log.gprd.gitlab.net/app/kibana#/visualize/create?type=line&indexPattern=c1ee6e20-fbf1-11ea-af41-ad80f197fa45&_a=(filters:!((meta:(key:json.type,params:pubsubbeat,type:phrase),query:(match:(json.type:(query:pubsubbeat,type:phrase))))),query:(language:kuery,query:''),vis:(aggs:!((enabled:!t,id:'1',params:(),schema:metric,type:count),(enabled:!t,id:'2',params:(drop_partials:!t,extended_bounds:(),field:'@timestamp',interval:auto,min_doc_count:1,scaleMetricValues:!f,timeRange:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}'),useNormalizedEsInterval:!t),schema:segment,type:date_histogram))))&_g=(time:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}')))
panels.title: Details

panels.description: Error rates are a measure of unhandled service exceptions per second. Client errors are excluded when possible. Lower is better

seriesOverrides.alias: 6h Degradation SLO (5% of monthly error budget)
1h Outage SLO (2% of monthly error budget)

targets.legendFormat: 6h Degradation SLO (5% of monthly error budget)
1h Outage SLO (2% of monthly error budget)

panels.title: pubsubbeat SLI Error Ratio

targets.expr:
sum (
  label_replace(
    vector(0) and on() (gitlab_component_errors:ratio_1h{component="pubsubbeat",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",type="logging"}),
    "period", "na", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(1) and on() (gitlab_component_errors:ratio_5m{component="pubsubbeat",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",type="logging"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (14.4 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{component="pubsubbeat",monitor="global",type="logging"})),
    "period", "5m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(2) and on() (gitlab_component_errors:ratio_1h{component="pubsubbeat",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",type="logging"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (14.4 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{component="pubsubbeat",monitor="global",type="logging"})),
    "period", "1h", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(4) and on() (gitlab_component_errors:ratio_30m{component="pubsubbeat",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",type="logging"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (6 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{component="pubsubbeat",monitor="global",type="logging"})),
    "period", "30m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(8) and on() (gitlab_component_errors:ratio_6h{component="pubsubbeat",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",type="logging"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (6 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{component="pubsubbeat",monitor="global",type="logging"})),
    "period", "6h", "", ""
  )
)

panels.description: The operation rate is the sum total of all requests being handle for all components within this service. Note that a single user request can lead to requests to multiple components. Higher is busier.

panels.description:
Ratio of requested CPU resources from allocatable resources.
Ideally we have requests utilization close to 100%. Values are
below 100% typically because pods do not fit well on nodes or
because we might be bound by memory requests already.
panels.title: Node CPU Requests Utilization

panels.description:
Ratio of requested Memory resources from allocatable resources.
Ideally we have requests utilization close to 100%. Values are
below 100% typically because pods do not fit well on nodes or
because we might be bound by CPU requests already.
panels.title: Node Memory Requests Utilization

panels.description:
Average CPU utilization per Node.

This resource measures all CPU across a fleet. If it is becoming saturated, it may indicate that the fleet needs horizontal or
vertical scaling. The metrics are coming from elasticsearch_exporter.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      avg by (environment, tier, type, stage) (
        avg_over_time(elasticsearch_process_cpu_percent{env="$environment",environment="$environment",type="logging"}[1m]) / 100
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: elastic_cpu component saturation: Average CPU Utilization per Node

panels.description:
Disk utilization per device per node.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      sum by (environment, tier, type, stage) (
        (elasticsearch_filesystem_data_size_bytes{env="$environment",environment="$environment",type="logging"} - elasticsearch_filesystem_data_free_bytes{env="$environment",environment="$environment",type="logging"})
      )
      /
      sum by (environment, tier, type, stage) (
        elasticsearch_filesystem_data_size_bytes{env="$environment",environment="$environment",type="logging"}
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: elastic_disk_space component saturation: Disk Utilization Overall

panels.description:
JVM heap memory utilization per node.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, name) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      elasticsearch_jvm_memory_used_bytes{area="heap", env="$environment",environment="$environment",type="logging"}
      /
      elasticsearch_jvm_memory_max_bytes{area="heap", env="$environment",environment="$environment",type="logging"}
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: elastic_jvm_heap_memory component saturation: JVM Heap Utilization per Node

panels.description:
Average CPU per Node.

This resource measures all CPU across a fleet. If it is becoming saturated, it may indicate that the fleet needs horizontal or
vertical scaling. The metrics are coming from elasticsearch_exporter.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, name) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      avg_over_time(elasticsearch_process_cpu_percent{env="$environment",environment="$environment",type="logging"}[5m]) / 100
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: elastic_single_node_cpu component saturation: Average CPU Utilization per Node

panels.description:
Disk utilization per device per node.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, name) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      (
        (
          elasticsearch_filesystem_data_size_bytes{env="$environment",environment="$environment",type="logging"}
          -
          elasticsearch_filesystem_data_free_bytes{env="$environment",environment="$environment",type="logging"}
        )
        /
        elasticsearch_filesystem_data_size_bytes{env="$environment",environment="$environment",type="logging"}
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: elastic_single_node_disk_space component saturation: Disk Utilization per Device per Node

panels.description:
Utilization of each thread pool on each node.

Descriptions of the threadpool types can be found at
https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/modules-threadpool.html.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, name, exported_type) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      (
        avg_over_time(elasticsearch_thread_pool_active_count{exported_type!="snapshot", env="$environment",environment="$environment",type="logging"}[5m])
        /
        (avg_over_time(elasticsearch_thread_pool_threads_count{exported_type!="snapshot", env="$environment",environment="$environment",type="logging"}[5m]) > 0)
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: elastic_thread_pools component saturation: Thread pool utilization

panels.description:
Kubernetes containers are allocated a share of CPU. When this is exhausted, the container may be thottled.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, pod, container) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      sum by (environment, tier, type, stage, pod, container) (
        rate(container_cpu_usage_seconds_total:labeled{container!="", container!="POD", env="$environment",environment="$environment",type="logging"}[5m])
      )
      /
      sum by(environment, tier, type, stage, pod, container) (
        container_spec_cpu_quota:labeled{container!="", container!="POD", env="$environment",environment="$environment",type="logging"}
        /
        container_spec_cpu_period:labeled{container!="", container!="POD", env="$environment",environment="$environment",type="logging"}
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: kube_container_cpu component saturation: Kube Container CPU Utilization

panels.description:
Records the total memory utilization for containers for this service, as a percentage of
the memory limit as configured through Kubernetes.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, pod, container) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      container_memory_working_set_bytes:labeled{container!="", container!="POD", env="$environment",environment="$environment",type="logging"}
      /
      (container_spec_memory_limit_bytes:labeled{container!="", container!="POD", env="$environment",environment="$environment",type="logging"} > 0)
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: kube_container_memory component saturation: Kube Container Memory Utilization

panels.description:
The [Horizontal Pod Autoscaler](https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/run-application/horizontal-pod-autoscale/)
automatically scales the number of Pods in a deployment based on metrics.

The Horizontal Pod Autoscaler has a configured upper maximum. When this
limit is reached, the HPA will not increase the number of pods and other
resource saturation (eg, CPU, memory) may occur.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, horizontalpodautoscaler, shard) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      kube_horizontalpodautoscaler_status_desired_replicas:labeled{env="$environment",environment="$environment",type="logging", shard!~"database-throttled|elasticsearch|gitaly-throttled|imports|memory-bound|urgent-other"}
      /
      kube_horizontalpodautoscaler_spec_max_replicas:labeled{env="$environment",environment="$environment",type="logging", shard!~"database-throttled|elasticsearch|gitaly-throttled|imports|memory-bound|urgent-other"}
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: kube_horizontalpodautoscaler_desired_replicas component saturation: Horizontal Pod Autoscaler Desired Replicas

panels.description:
Open file descriptor utilization per instance.

Saturation on file descriptor limits may indicate a resource-descriptor leak in the application.

As a temporary fix, you may want to consider restarting the affected process.
 Lower is better.
panels.title: open_fds component saturation: Open file descriptor utilization per instance
